headline: Scores of Congressional Republicans Are Coming to Wyoming to Let Liz Cheney Know How Much She Sucks
author: Matt Vespa
sentences:
You're not one of us anymore (via Daily Caller):
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy said over 100 Republicans from Congress will be supporting Republican Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney's primary opponent, Harriet Hageman, in an exclusive interview with the Daily Caller.
Although McCarthy did not mention the names of Republicans attending the event or where it will be held, he did say Cheney simply has not been doing any work for the people of Wyoming.
The minority leader and House Republicans have been very critical of Cheney and said the best way to move forward with Cheney is to help Hageman, who are running for her seat.
McCarthy, who endorsed Cheney's primary opponent in February, told the Caller that over 100 Republican members will be supporting Hageman at an event at the end of March.
For those who complain about the rise of alt-right-ish types within the conservative movement, wellthis is how they're born.
The base has endured the games of too many squishy losers who would rather lose with honor than win.
She lost her leadership position on the Hill for a simple reason: she wouldn't get with the times.
There are over 100 congressional Republicans who intend to back Cheney's primary challenger.
When those who promised to fight for us either don't do it or cave to other interests.
There's more than 100 members that are co-sponsoring that,? McCarthy told the Caller.
Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) has done everything she can to infuriate her own party base.
Her only path to salvation is the hope that enough Wyoming Democrats vote for her.
She's openly declared war on Trumpism within the GOP, but she's all alone.
Your conference doesn't determine whether you're a Republican or Democrat.
You're going to find there's going to be an event for Harriet next week.
She's on the Democrats' dog and pony show committee on January 6.
It's not like she's going to be homeless if she leaves Congress.
Liz must know her media hits only help our enemies, right?
She's being played by Democrats and seems okay with that.
They're descending into Wyoming for the occasion as well.
And the way to go about it is exactly what I'm doing.
The GOP is populist-leaning right now.
Maybe it's just time to call it.
I support Harriet in Wyoming.
She calls all of them crazy.
You get to determine that.
Yeah, she has no friends.
I'd be infuriated too.
Read the room, Lizzy.
No one knows this.
She's never home.
The GOP is Trump.
